elementSpec.desc: identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text.
marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect.
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.
identifies any word or phrase which is regarded as linguistically distinct, for example as archaic, technical, dialectal, non-preferred, etc., or as forming part of a sublanguage.

attDef.desc: specifies the sublanguage or register to which the word or phrase is being assigned
specifies how the phrase is distinct diachronically
specifies how the phrase is distinct diatopically
specifies how the phrase is distinct diastatically

elementSpec.desc: indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.

attDef.desc: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

elementSpec.desc: contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.

elementSpec.gloss: separated from the surrounding text with quotation marks
elementSpec.desc: contains material which is marked as (ostensibly) being somehow different than the surrounding text, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned not used.

attDef.desc: may be used to indicate whether the offset passage is spoken or thought, or to characterize it more finely.

valItem.desc: representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue
refering to itself, not its normal referant

elementSpec.desc: contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example.
marks words or phrases mentioned, not used.
contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics.
contains a brief description of the purpose and application for an element, attribute, or attribute value.
identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.

attDef.desc: identifies the associated term element by an absolute or relative URI reference
attDef.valDesc: should be a valid URI reference that resolves to a term element

attDef.desc: identifies the associated term element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
attDef.valDesc: the result of applying the algorithm for the resolution of canonical references (described in section ) should be a valid URI reference that resolves to a term element

elementSpec.desc: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.

attDef.desc: identifies the associated gloss element by an absolute or relative URI reference
attDef.valDesc: should be a valid URI reference that resolves to a gloss element

attDef.desc: identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
attDef.valDesc: the result of applying the algorithm for the resolution of canonical references (described in section ) should be a valid URI reference that resolves to a gloss element

attDef.desc: supplies the sort key for this term in an index.

elementSpec.gloss: latin for thusTO BE TRANSLATED or soTO BE TRANSLATED
elementSpec.desc: contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.
contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.
groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.
contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.
contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.

indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible or inaudible.

attDef.desc: gives the reason for omission. Sample values include sampling, illegible, inaudible, irrelevant, cancelled, cancelled and illegible.
attDef.valDesc: any short indication of the reason for the omission.

attDef.desc: in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand, signifies the hand which made the deletion.
attDef.valDesc: must be one of the hand identifiers declared in the document header (see section ).

attDef.desc: In the case of text omitted because of damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

valItem.desc: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface

attDef.desc: indicates approximately how much text has been omitted from the transcription (using the unit specified on the unit attribute), either because of editorial policy or because a deletion, damage, or other cause has rendered transcription impossible.
names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap

valItem.desc: pages, i.e. one side of a leaf

elementSpec.desc: contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.

attDef.desc: indicates why the material is hard to transcribe.
attDef.valDesc: any phrase describing the difficulty, e.g. faded, ambient noise, passing truck, ill formed, eccentric ductus.

attDef.desc: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.
attDef.valDesc: must be one of the hand identifiers declared in the document header (see section ).

attDef.desc: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

valItem.desc: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface

elementSpec.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

attDef.desc: indicates the type of the object which is being named by the phrase.
attDef.valDesc: Values such as person, place, institution, product, acronym.

elementSpec.desc: contains a general purpose name or referring string.

attDef.desc: indicates more specifically the object referred to by the referencing string. Values might include person, place, ship, element etc.

elementSpec.desc: contains an e-mail address identifying a location to which e-mail messages can be delivered.
contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.
contains one line of a postal address.
a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.
contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.

elementSpec.gloss: postal box or post office box
elementSpec.desc: contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address.
contains a number, written in any form.

attDef.desc: indicates the type of numeric value.

valItem.desc: fraction, e.g. one half or three-quarters

attDef.desc: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

elementSpec.desc: contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.

attDef.desc: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

elementSpec.desc: contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.
contains a date in any format.

attDef.desc: indicates the system or calendar to which the date belongs.

elementSpec.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.
contains an abbreviation of any sort.

attDef.desc: allows the encoder to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology.

valItem.desc: the abbreviation provides the first letter(s) of the word or phrase, omitting the remainder.
the abbreviation omits some letter(s) in the middle.
the abbreviation comprises a special symbol or mark.
the abbreviation includes writing above the line.
the abbreviation comprises the initial letters of the words of a phrase.
the abbreviation is for a title of address (Dr, Ms, Mr, â€¦)
the abbreviation is for the name of an organization.
the abbreviation is for a geographic name.

elementSpec.desc: contains the expansion of an abbreviation.
defines a pointer to another location.

attDef.desc: specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying one or more URI References
attDef.valDesc: One or more syntactically valid URI references, separated by white space. Because whitespace is used to separate URIs, no whitespace is permitted inside a single URI. If a whitespace character is required in a URI, it should be escaped with the normal mechanism, e.g. TEI%20Consortium.

attDef.desc: specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
attDef.valDesc: the result of applying the algorithm for the resolution of canonical references (described in section ) should be a valid URI reference to the intended target

elementSpec.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

attDef.desc: specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References
attDef.valDesc: One or more syntactically valid URI references, separated by white space. Because whitespace is used to separate URIs, no whitespace is permitted inside a single URI. If a whitespace character is required in a URI, it should be escaped with the normal mechanism, e.g. TEI%20Consortium.

attDef.desc: specifies the destination of the reference by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
attDef.valDesc: the result of applying the algorithm for the resolution of canonical references (described in section ) should be a valid URI reference to the intended target

elementSpec.desc: contains any sequence of items organized as a list.

attDef.desc: describes the form of the list.

valItem.desc: list items are numbered or lettered.
list items are marked with a bullet or other typographic device.
list items are not numbered or bulleted.
each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.

elementSpec.desc: contains one component of a list.
contains the label associated with an item in a list; in glossaries, marks the term being defined.
contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.
contains the heading for the label or term column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
contains the heading for the item or gloss column in a glossary list or similar structured list.

attDef.valDesc: Values can be taken from any convenient typology of annotation suitable to the work in hand; e.g. annotation, gloss, citation, digression, preliminary, temporary

attDef.desc: indicates who is responsible for the annotation: author, editor, translator, etc.
attDef.valDesc: a pointer to one of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, encoding, or annotation

attDef.desc: indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.
indicates the point (or points) of attachment for a note, or the beginning of the span to which the note is attached.
attDef.valDesc: reference to the xml:ids of element(s) which begin at the location in question (e.g. the xml:id of an anchor element).

attDef.desc: points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.
attDef.valDesc: reference to the xml:id(s) of element(s) which end at the location(s) in question, or to an empty element at the point in question.

elementSpec.desc: marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose.

attDef.desc: supplies a name to specify which index (of several) the index entry belongs to.
attDef.valDesc: an application-specific name, consisting of Unicode characters only.

elementSpec.desc: indicates the location of an inline graphic, illustration, or figure.

attDef.desc: The display width of the image
The display height of the image
A scale factor to be applied to the image to make it the desired display size

attDef.valDesc: A URL which refers to the image itself.

elementSpec.desc: provides encoded binary data representing an inline graphic or other object.

attDef.desc: The display width of the object
The display height of the object
A scale factor to be applied to the object to make it the desired display size
The encoding used to encode the binary data. If not specified, this is assumed to be Base64.

elementSpec.desc: marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, as indicated by changes in a standard reference system, where the section is not represented by a structural element.

attDef.desc: indicates the edition or version to which the milestone applies.
attDef.valDesc: Any string of characters; usually a siglum conventionally used for the edition.

attDef.desc: provides a conventional name for the kind of section changing at this milestone.

valItem.desc: physical page breaks (synonymous with the pb element).
line breaks (synonymous with the lb element).
any units termed book, liber, etc.
cantos or other major sections of a poem.
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto.
scenes within a play or act.
passages not present in the reference edition.

elementSpec.desc: marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system.

attDef.desc: indicates the edition or version in which the page break is located at this point
attDef.valDesc: Any string of characters; usually a siglum conventionally used for the edition.

elementSpec.desc: marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.

attDef.desc: indicates the edition or version in which the line break is located at this point
attDef.valDesc: Any string of characters; usually a siglum conventionally used for the edition.

elementSpec.desc: marks the boundary between one column of a text and the next in a standard reference system.

attDef.desc: indicates the edition or version in which the column break is located at this point
attDef.valDesc: Any string of characters; usually a siglum conventionally used for the edition.

elementSpec.desc: contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).
contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.
in a bibliographic reference, contains the name of the author(s), personal or corporate, of a work; the primary statement of responsibility for any bibliographic item.
secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.

attDef.desc: specifies the nature of the intellectual responsibility
attDef.valDesc: semi-open list (examples might include: translator, editor, compiler, illustrator, etc.)

elementSpec.desc: supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply.
contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.
contains the full title of a work of any kind.

attDef.desc: indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.

valItem.desc: analytic title (article, poem, or other item published as part of a larger item)
monographic title (book, collection, or other item published as a distinct item, including single volumes of multi-volume works)
title of unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)

attDef.desc: classifies the title according to some convenient typology.

valItem.desc: alternate title, often in another language, by which the work is also known
descriptive paraphrase of the work functioning as a title

elementSpec.desc: contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.
groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of pagenumbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.

attDef.desc: identifies the type of information conveyed by the element, e.g. pages, volume.

valItem.desc: the element contains a volume number.
the element contains an issue number, or volume and issue numbers.
the element contains a page number or page range.
the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)
the element identifies a part of a book or collection.

elementSpec.desc: contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.
contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.
contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic subelements appear and in a specified order.
contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.
contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.
contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.

attDef.desc: specifies whether or not the line is metrically complete.

valItem.desc: either the line is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
the initial part of an incomplete line
a medial part of an incomplete line
the final part of an incomplete line

elementSpec.desc: contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.
A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.
contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.

attDef.desc: indicates the kind of stage direction.

valItem.desc: is a narrative, motivating stage direction.
gives some detail about a character.
more than one of the above

elementSpec.desc: contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text.

attDef.desc: The version of the TEI scheme
attDef.valDesc: A number identifying the version of the TEI guidelines

elementSpec.desc: indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.

attDef.desc: specifies what type of generated text division (e.g. index, table of contents, etc.) is to appear.

valItem.desc: an index is to be generated and inserted at this point.
